intro: Galium valdepilosum, commonly known as the valley pilose bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium valdepilosum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, slightly fuzzy appearance.
